alert.note: Alert for Book Cliffs; Eastern Uintah Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 16 at 3:09PM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 486 AND 487 BELOW 6500 FEET... The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Red Flag Warning below 6500 feet for thunderstorms, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...In Utah, Fire Weather Zone 486 Eastern Uinta Basin and Fire Weather Zone 487 Book Cliffs below 6500 feet. * IMPACTS...Dry lightning will likely cause fire starts in the afternoon and evening hours. Many if not all of the storms will bring a threat of gusty outflow winds. * THUNDERSTORMS...Will form early in the afternoon and continue through the evening hours. The biggest threat will occur late afternoon through the early evening hours. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and variable winds of 40 to 50 mph are possible from any convection that forms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
